Package edu.dselent.assignment00

Class ConnectN

java.lang.Object
edu.dselent.assignment00.ConnectN
public class ConnectN
extends java.lang.Object
Class to hold the state of the game and operations on the game state

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static int DEFAULT_COLUMNS
    The default number of columns Set this to 7
    private static int DEFAULT_ROWS
    The default number of rows Set this to 6
    private static int DEFAULT_WINNING_NUMBER
    The default number of chips in a row to win the game Set this to 4
    private int[][] gameState
    Two-dimensional array to represent the state of the game
    The rows start at index 0 at the top of the board
    The columns start at index 0 at the left of the board
    Cells contain values {0 = empty, 1 = player 1, 2 = player 2}
    private int lastColumn
    The column index of the last chip inserted
    This makes the win check algorithms much easier and efficient to program
    private int lastRow
    The row index of the last chip inserted
    This makes the win check algorithms much easier and efficient to program
    private int numberOfColumns
    The number of columns in the game "board"
    private int numberOfRows
    The number of rows in the game "board"
    private int playerTurn
    The current player's turn
    private int winningNumber
    The number of chips in a row needed to win the game

    • numberOfRows

      private int numberOfRows
      The number of rows in the game "board"

    • numberOfColumns

      private int numberOfColumns
      The number of columns in the game "board"

    • winningNumber

      private int winningNumber
      The number of chips in a row needed to win the game

    • playerTurn

      private int playerTurn
      The current player's turn

    • gameState

      private int[][] gameState
      Two-dimensional array to represent the state of the game
      The rows start at index 0 at the top of the board
      The columns start at index 0 at the left of the board
      Cells contain values {0 = empty, 1 = player 1, 2 = player 2}

    • lastRow

      private int lastRow
      The row index of the last chip inserted
      This makes the win check algorithms much easier and efficient to program

    • lastColumn

      private int lastColumn
      The column index of the last chip inserted
      This makes the win check algorithms much easier and efficient to program

      numberOfColumns = 7

      Initializes gameState to all zeroes
      playerTurn = 1
      lastRow = -1
      lastColumn = -1

    • ConnectN

      public ConnectN​(int numberOfRows, int numberOfColumns, int winningNumber)
      Sets the number of rows, columns, and winning number to the values provided
      Initializes gameState to all zeroes
      playerTurn = 1
      lastRow = -1
      lastColumn = -1
      Parameters:
      numberOfRows - The number of rows for the game
      numberOfColumns - The number of columns for the game
      winningNumber - The number of chips in a row to win the game

      Switches turns from players 1 and 2

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Resets the game
      Sets all cells in the "board" to a zero value
      playerTurn = 1
      lastRow = -1
      lastColumn = -1

    • isGameFull

      public boolean isGameFull()
      Determines if there are any open spaces left on the "board"
      Returns:
      Return true is there are any open spaces, false if there are not any open spaces

    • insertChip

      public boolean insertChip​(int columnNumber)
      Attempts to insert a chip into the "board" at the given column index
      Parameters:
      columnNumber - The index of the column to insert the chip
      Returns:
      Returns true is the chip could be inserted, false if the chip could not be inserted

    • detectWin

      public int detectWin()
      Determines if and who has won the game
      Returns:
      Returns the player number who won or -1 if no player has won

    • detectWinColumns

      private int detectWinColumns()
      Determines if a player has Connect-N via columns
      Returns:
      Returns the player number who won or -1 if no player has won

    • detectWinRows

      private int detectWinRows()
      Determines if a player has Connect-N via rows
      Returns:
      Returns the player number who won or -1 if no player has won

    • detectWinDiagonals

      private int detectWinDiagonals()
      Determines if a player has Connect-N via diagonals
      Returns:
      Returns the player number who won or -1 if no player has won

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
